template.name: LibVirt KVM
template.description: This template should be manually linked to a host.
template.readme:
## Overview
This template is designed for the effortless deployment of VMware ESX hypervisor monitoring and doesn't require any external scripts.
This template can be used in discovery as well as manually linked to a host.
For additional information, please see [Zabbix documentation on VM monitoring](https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/7.4/manual/vm_monitoring).
To use this template as manually linked to a host, attach it to the host and manually set the `Hypervisor UUID` host wizard configuration field.
## Setup
To use this template as manually linked to a host: 1. Compile Zabbix server with the required options (`--with-libxml2` and `--with-libcurl`) 2. Set the `StartVMwareCollectors` option in the Zabbix server configuration file to "1" or more 3. Set the host wizard configuration fields required for VMware authentication: `VMware URL`, `VMware username` and `VMware password` 4. To get the hypervisor UUID, enable access to the hypervisor via SSH and log in via SSH using a valid login and password. 5. Run the following command and specify the UUID in the `Hypervisor UUID` host wizard configuration field: ```text vim-cmd hostsvc/hostsummary | grep uuid ```
Note: To enable discovery of hardware sensors of VMware hypervisors, set the host wizard configuration field `Monitoring of hardware sensors` to the selected state.

item.name: Hypervisor ping

trigger.name: VMware Hypervisor: Hypervisor is down
trigger.description: The service is unavailable or is not accepting ICMP pings.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU Idle Time
item.description: Aggregated CPU usage across all cores on the host in seconds.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU IO Wait Time
item.description: Aggregated CPU usage across all cores on the host in seconds.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU IO Wait in percent
item.description: CPU IO Wait as a percentage during the interval.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU System Time
item.description: Aggregated CPU usage across all cores on the host in seconds.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU threads per core
item.description: Number of physical CPU threads per core.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU usage in percent
item.description: CPU usage as a percentage during the interval.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU User Time
item.description: Aggregated CPU usage across all cores on the host in seconds.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU vCores
item.description: Number of physical CPU cores on the host. Physical CPU cores are the processors contained by a CPU package.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU current frequency
item.description: The current speed of the CPU cores. This is an average value if there are multiple speeds. The product of CPU frequency and the number of cores is approximately equal to the sum of the MHz for all the individual cores on the host.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU model
item.description: The CPU model.

item.name: Hypervisor CPU Cores
item.description: Number of physical cores in server

item.name: Hypervisor KSM % Merged pages
item.description:
Percentage of mergeable pages currently merged by KSM,
divide the system-wide pages_shared value by the total number of offered pages (pages_shared + pages_sharing + pages_unshared + pages_volatile) and multiply by 100.
Alternatively, a simpler metric of KSM effectiveness is the ratio of pages_sharing to pages_shared, which indicates the efficiency of page sharing

item.name: Hypervisor KSM general profit
item.description:
memory savings achieved by the KSM mechanism on a system-wide level, found in the file /sys/kernel/mm/ksm/general_profit. It reflects the total memory saved by merging identical memory pages into shared, single copies. A higher value for general_profit signifies that KSM is effectively reducing memory consumption by deduplicating memory pages
If you see a value of 6461704512 in the general_profit file, it indicates that KSM has saved over 6GB of memory by de-duplicating identical pages across the system
A negative value means that memory savings is less than memory required to store memory pointers for deduplication.

item.name: Hypervisor KSM shared memory
item.description: general_profit:-10802240 memory_scanned:992432128 memory_shared:2228224 memory_sharing:3985408 memory_unshared:5009408 memory_volatile:935186432 memory_skipped:0 stable_node_chains: 0 stable_node_dups: 0 ksm_zero_pages: 0 ksm_zero_memory:0

item.name: Hypervisor KSM sharing memory
item.description: How many more sites are sharing this memory using the same memory shared i.e. how much memory saved

item.name: Hypervisor KSM Eficiency of page sharing
item.description:
Percentage of mergeable pages currently merged by KSM,
divide the system-wide pages_shared value by the total number of offered pages (pages_shared + pages_sharing + pages_unshared + pages_volatile) and multiply by 100.
Alternatively, a simpler metric of KSM effectiveness is the ratio of pages_sharing to pages_shared, which indicates the efficiency of page sharing

item.name: Hypervisor KSM unshared memory
item.description: Wow many memory unique but repeatedly checked for merging

item.name: Hypervisor KSM volatile memory
item.description: How many memory changing too fast to be placed in a tree

item.name: Hypervisor memory total
item.description: The physical memory size.

item.name: Hypervisor Model
item.description: The system model identification.

item.name: Hypervisor Bios UUID
item.description: The hardware BIOS identification.

item.name: Hypervisor library
item.description: The Running Hypervisor compiled library version.

item.name: Hypervisor memory cached
item.description: Physical memory free on the host.

item.name: Hypervisor memory free
item.description: Physical memory free on the host.

item.name: Hypervisor version
item.description: The Running Hyperviso identification.

item.name: HV: Get KSM data
item.description:
KSM Stats:
general_profit: how effective is KSM. Memory saved - Memory consumed memory_scanned: how many pages are being scanned for ksm pages_shared: how many shared pages are being used pages_sharing: how many more sites are sharing them i.e. how much saved pages_unshared: how many pages unique but repeatedly checked for merging pages_volatile: how many pages changing too fast to be placed in a tree pages_skipped: how many pages did the “smart” page scanning algorithm skip stable_node_chains: the number of KSM pages that hit the max_page_sharing limit stable_node_dups: number of duplicated KSM pages ksm_zero_pages: how many zero pages that are still mapped into processes were mapped by KSM when deduplicating.
When use_zero_pages is/was enabled, the sum of pages_sharing + ksm_zero_pages represents the actual number of pages saved by KSM. if use_zero_pages has never been enabled, ksm_zero_pages is 0.
A high ratio of pages_sharing to pages_shared indicates good sharing, but a high ratio of pages_unshared to pages_sharing indicates wasted effort. pages_volatile embraces several different kinds of activity, but a high proportion there would also indicate poor use of madvise MADV_MERGEABLE.
The maximum possible pages_sharing/pages_shared ratio is limited by the max_page_sharing tunable. To increase the ratio max_page_sharing must be increased accordingly.

item.name: VM CPU usage in percent
item.description: CPU usage as a percentage during the interval.

item.name: Guest memory available
item.description: Amount of guest physical memory available to the guest

item.name: Guest memory disk cache
item.description: The amount of memory that can be reclaimed without additional I/O, typically disk caches (in KiB)

item.name: Guest memory swapped
item.description: Amount of guest physical memory that is swapped out to the swap space.

item.name: Guest memory current size
item.description: Guest current memory assigned

item.name: Host memory usage
item.description: The amount of host physical RSS memory allocated to the VM.

item.name: Snapshot count
item.description: Snapshot count of the guest VM.

item.name: Snapshot latest date
item.description: Latest snapshot date of the guest VM.

item.name: VM Get block stats
item.description: Global block statistics of the guest VM.

item.name: Number of virtual CPUs
item.description: Number of virtual CPUs assigned to the guest.

item.name: VM Get memory statistics
item.description:
Memory statistics of the guest VM.
Explanation of fields: swap_in - The amount of data read from swap space (in KiB) swap_out - The amount of memory written out to swap space (in KiB) major_fault - The number of page faults where disk IO was required minor_fault - The number of other page faults unused - The amount of memory left unused by the system (in KiB) available - The amount of usable memory as seen by the domain (in KiB) actual - Current balloon value (in KiB) rss - Resident Set Size of the running domain's process (in KiB) usable - The amount of memory which can be reclaimed by balloon without causing host swapping (in KiB) last-update - Timestamp of the last update of statistics (in seconds) disk_caches - The amount of memory that can be reclaimed without additional I/O, typically disk caches (in KiB) hugetlb_pgalloc - The number of successful huge page allocations initiated from within the domain hugetlb_pgfail - The number of failed huge page allocations initiated from within the domain

item.name: VM Get domain stats
item.description: Global domain statistics of the guest VM.

item.name: VM domain control
item.description: displays the state of an interface to the hypervisor that is used to control a specified guest virtual machine. For states that are not OK or Error, it will also print the number of seconds that have elapsed since the control interface entered the displayed state.

item.name: VM domain display
item.description: show the domain display URI

item.name: VM host name
item.description: Host name of the guest VM.

item.name: Uptime of guest OS
item.description: Total time elapsed since the last operating system boot-up (in seconds). Data is collected if Guest OS Add-ons (QEMU Guest Tools) are installed.

parameters.parameter: Performance counter data is not available.

item_prototype.name: Get block statistics [{#DISKNAME}]
item_prototype.description:
Get block/disk statistics
rd_req - count of read operations rd_bytes - count of read bytes wr_req - count of write operations wr_bytes - count of written bytes errs - error count flush_operations - count of flush operations rd_total_times - total time read operations took (ns) wr_total_times - total time write operations took (ns) flush_total_times - total time flush operations took (ns)
